@shexwavey well, that's the big difference between hard numbers and clearly defined policy trends and subjective art evaluation, I guess. :)
@gradywsmith thanks, much appreciated. :)
@RichardJohans13 do you think I've got time to run two YouTube channels, lol? And what sort of audience would watch me talk finance?
@RichardJohans13 hey, I have a degree in economics and I work in finance. You get the whole package. :)
Now granted, this is a worst-case scenario... but Trump's administration is already testing the waters. Again, REAL ECONOMIC DANGER.
In other words, if you thought the fiscal crisis in 2008 or 1987 or 1929 was bad... WHOO BOY.
You'd see a capital flight almost immediately from the US dollar and US investments, because now that value becomes linked to US gov't.
But the symbolism if anything means more, because it implies the US Fed is not independent, which would throw central banking into chaos.
...mostly because he knows that just printing more money cranks up inflation and devalues the US dollar, which hurts worldwide BIG TIME.
Now the Federal Reserve is independent - if the US government tried this, the head of the Fed would resign and protest and tell him to GTFO.
They could choose to fund with emergency measures (like Bush did with Iraq and Afghanistan), but why not go to the Fed to print more money?
Say the Trump administration needs a sudden infusion of cash, because they got involved in some sort of war/infrastructure project...
Now, to explain how Trump could manipulate the Fed in a simple way (because simple is the only way you explain this)... okay, follow this.
@kyliewilson global, given how much other countries hold US currency as reserve and build off of US Fed policy. This impacts EVERYONE.
@WillMcAvoyACN, @KeithOlbermann, please signal boost this NOW - Trump's admin making plays to meddle with the Fed: https://t.co/2Nsyt3yXIq
...well, let's say that if he watches the DOW as carefully as rumors say, he's in for the rudest awakening possible. THIS WILL BE BAD.
And any sane government would understand this, but we're not dealing with sane. If Trump tries to interfere with the money supply/banking...
This, more than anything, highlights Trump's administration's total lack of qualifications. YOU DON'T TOUCH THE FEDERAL RESERVE.
And thus, it's a huge red flag when governments try to interfere with financial instruments they do not understand for political benefit.
There's a very big reason why federal reserve banking operates independently of governments - insane complexity and insuring liquidity.
Background: this is Trump's administration testing the waters to meddling with the Federal Reserve. Modern banking relies on this.
This might be one of the most genuinely terrifying things I've seen from the administration to date. READ NOW: https://t.co/2Nsyt3QyzY
@musicloverjd not surprised at all. More a failure to change with the time - I know plenty of record stores that remain open to this day.

@Laughing_Cynic_ keep in mind the NDP have never gotten federal power per se, although they have been the lead opposition before.
@Laughing_Cynic_ we also have the NDP, which is economic left, social left.
@Laughing_Cynic_ not quite. Conservatives are closer to economic right, social left/middle, liberals are economic middle, social left/middle
@Laughing_Cynic_ pretty similar, yeah. Not exactly, but there are close elements. I used to identify as Conservative for a while growing up.
@Laughing_Cynic_ pretty much, though some conservatives try to import socially regressive policies... and end up getting their asses kicked.
